QntQ-_s5WZP9PUuwiiDCDw.text: I've went to the Park Mall branch some time ago. Ambience was good. but pricing for the menu was quite expensive in my opinion, expensive for tea time. don't think i would visit again

YncGCz1Stno7Z666-ufX9g.text: Kith is a cute, cozy place on the quieter side of Robertson Quay .  It's one of those places I'd been meaning to try for years, literally, and I finally got round to it about about 2 months ago - this tells you I've got quite a backlog of reviews!Kith offers a decent selection of food (ranging from biccies to small bites to traditional full breakfasts and to sandwiches) at reasonable price points, e.g. $10 for a sandwich.  Our table only tried several simple food items like the smoked salmon sandwich, brioche with yogurt and strawberries, and a tuna + green apple toastie.  Even simple dishes can sometimes go awry, but I'm happy to report that all these items were well executed and presented.Where I felt a bit let down was in the coffee department.  I'd heard a lot about Kith's coffee and had been tremendously looking forward to trying it.  However, the coffee was disappointingly average.  I'd certainly put places like Toby's Estate and Smitten above Kith in the coffee stakes.Still, Kith is a pleasant place that's hard to dislike.  It's a comfortable place which is family-friendly, pet-friendly and offers ample people watching opportunities.  If I lived in RQ, I'd be happy to call it my local.

9JSt1jAxsnw0ZRYmMABayg.text: Quirky little cafe by the river (canal?). I like how it's hidden from everything else, like a little sanctuary.Brunch sets and coffee here are average but the laid back atmosphere makes up for it. Salads and juices are great, the first time I visited Kith, I wanted something more than what was offer on the blackboard so I asked if I could request for a specific salad. I was in luck because the person who would soon say yes was none other than lady boss Jane herself.So I had a ginger grilled chicken salad with baby spinach, wild rocket, japanese cucumber and cherry tomatoes, and have had it again every time I return. It tastes awesome.Perfect for a lazy weekend.

gmSuy7Rw2oJnrhEmm4Fy6w.text: If you like your food home-made style, then you should check this place out. A good time to go would be during breakfast so you can try out the toast and homed strawberry jam that is quite good actually. Coffee on the other hand, was just average and nothing to shout about. The place is quite stuffy so don't come overdressed or you'll be perspiring throughout your meal, which is never good.

Y9TiBR2Dr54M81bN1nYXwQ.text: Kith Café is an awesome hole in the wall along the Singapore River. It actually recently just expanded but before was literally a tiny little space frequented by the River Valley neighborhood. Staff is super friendly and the food is simple but very satisfying. Go for their breakfast which is served with the best toast in Singapore and home-made strawberry jam. Their coffee is pretty great too. Try the Kith macchiato, which is espresso, chocolate, topped with a marshmallow. They recently expanded to a bigger space, in the same location. Have lunch outdoors facing the Singapore River. They also just opened a new branch in Park Mall, serving dinner as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

-k-Y02CyDfQzorgH5yyjyg.text: Paired with the glistening surface of the Singapore River and the occasional bumbleboat whizzing by, a sip of ice-cold liquefied Nutella blended with nuttily fragrant hazelnut ice cream over at Kith Café is the rest-stop for winners after a day-long poach at flea markets at Clarke Quay. Drink it before it melts - it is good to the very last drop!

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. A Nutella milkshake... Yum!

FjUwUD0J41SQwXD4PLyNDA.text: Kith is the little cafe with outdoor seating right along the river to the west of the Martin Road bridge.  This is a favorite of congregations of expat wives with black spandex leggings walking their dogs.  Their brunch-y fare hits the spot - especially the smoothies - but don't expect huge portions.  The atmosphere is homey, friendly and sweet.  A nice place to meet friends, especially on weekdays when it's not as crowded as on the weekends.

OX__uDXYdXmk7MqfoH6nRQ.text: Love the bfast in here w the view n services are great too. Its still my fave plcs to go for bfast among all 3 outlets that they have in sg.

8uXR5_QatDWVwdGN9QYYZg.text: A great little cafe down at Rob Quay. This place is always swelling with people, no matter what day of the week and once you have been in there it is evident why. Great coffee, fresh, tasty simple food and mouth watering fruit juices every time. Service with a smile is guaranteed. I've eaten many of their meals in the past and each time they have been delicious.

pyd11TCbv4zqm7jM34N9NQ.text: This is a nice location, right by the river. It has a relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. The breakfast we had was a little expensive - $17 SGD each, but the portions are "Westernized" - they're a lot larger than other places.I like the coffee - my cappuccino was good. My girlfriend really liked her Earl Grey Lavender & Orange tea.This is a nice place to hang out and relax.

yvf0huK8OsOgVCJkYG9ZnQ.text: Nice small breakfast restaurant visited mostly by foreigners due to their western style menu. Everything just tastes very good so this is definitely a 5 star rating. And the coffee tastes how coffee is supposed to taste. Not like the watery Starbucks coffee but very good quality coffee. You sit outside in the shade. There are newspapers to read and children can play.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. You site outside in the shade
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Children can play
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Opening hours

PM5wjKCxV7-yqnT36Fs95g.text: Right along the river...walking difference from severalHotels..we were at four points and found it handy..prices are pretty reasonable by Singapore standards...latte was really good...I had a bacon egg and cheese toast sandwich and it was only $6 and it was really good...wish they were open earlier for us jet lagged folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cool logo
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Latte was really good
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Seating area

DouuvIluVz4N7m3aOsypnA.text: I stopped by here when wandering from Clarke Quay towards Robertson Quay when the hunger and heat got the better of me and I just had to stop somewhere. I saw Kith and recalled that I had been at their other location by Dhoby Ghaut and did not find it horrible so I was up for giving it a shot (and to be honest at this point I would probably even have given McDonalds a chance). Kith has a pretty relaxed setting at a corner of a house with some shade but it does not really have any seats inside so even if it is shaded it is still fairly warm.I had some pretty decent pasta with a pretty good flat white while S went for a toastie and a freshly pressed juice. Neither of these were anything special but more what one can expect and prices are a bit higher than I would like to pay but then it is Robertson Quay after all so perhaps to be expected. I have since been a few more times and they are in a sense reliable, there has so far never been anything amazing nor anything really disappointing. It can tend to get a bit too noisy around as many families with children appear to like to come here and at least when I have been there it has been the type of people who do not feel like telling their kids to behave and take it easy so if that disturbs you it may not be the best place.

Ckjrrg93ELYnTLDQxzYnnQ.text: I was looking for a simple place to grab a quick bite of breakfast before I continued my exploration of Singapore, and I had walked past here the day before so I decided to check it out. I must say that it wasn't really the best place that I had visited here in Singapore, but then again you can't always expect to strike it lucky when exploring a new city. Okay, I do have to say that the staff were pretty good, but when I looked at the menu there really wasn't anything all that appealing. The place was pretty small, so all of the seats were outside, and while their coffee was okay, it wasn't the best. Mind you, the locals seem to quite like the place since there were always people gathering around here (usually mums with their strollers). However if I am ever back this way I'd probably give this place a miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Outside
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Kith Cafe Inside
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Breakfast

fkf6jmA3sI-52KYhF-pw1g.text: Excited to try the place. Woke early on a Sunday morning and looking for spot nearby to "break" my fast. I was happy to see that this cafe opened early and served simple breakfast that I'm looking for. Initial impressions are that the spot gets a lot of recurring business which is always a good sign.I ordered a pretty standard breakfast that I would fix at home in the states. Eggs, bacon and some wheat toast. They also had fresh juice, I had the watermelon. For lack of a better word, it was homey. Just what I was looking for. It wasn't anything extraordinary but the cafe gave me enough to want to come back and try out the specials. It looks like people were very keen on the Kith Coffee, so I need to come back and get that. I love the neighborhoody feel and the friendly service. I'll definitely come back and will be making this part of my breakfast go to places.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Fresh watermelon
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My standard breakfast. Simple but hits the spot...and you don't feel too heavy after

8pxHdvw3DQqjEiTLebO_4w.text: I feel this cafe has good food potential and was certainly recommend. Coffee is quite strong which I do enjoy. My chocolate crossaint was great and partners mango smoothly delicious. However the bacon, egg, tomato toastie I felt was a little lack luster. What really let this place down was the speed of service. It took us 30mins to get the toastie and crossaint, which we needed to ask for as a reminder. Also be prepared to sit outdoor or take away. As there is no indoor seating.

KIliMMIPfwg8PHydjqtbNA.text: I've been coming here for so long..sometimes you forget to highlight a place because it's always there. What I like about Kith is that it's kinda cute and quirky, it's always sincere and honest..and that reflects in the coffee, food and service.It operates out of a tiny space but they expand quite a bit outside. The tables and chairs are built for small people (luckily I'm one) but many tall expatriates seem to squeeze in comfortably (kid in tow). I personally think the old location was prettier inside..more seating but the new location is less food-fumey and has more shade so I think overall it's better.The food is simple and straightforward but there are little touches of brilliance. Love their white bread in the big brek always nicely toasted and love the homely strawberry jam - it really looks like someone spent all day cooking it on the hearth.Free wifi - always a nice bonus.Prices for the big brek and coffee are attractive. I've had the toastie several times for a lighter bite and it's very simple but it's served nice and hot with a tart apple salad on the side.The coffee is not the best but it's usually a nice to good cup..at $3.80 it's worth it. If you get a cup that's over-extracted and bitter, give your feedback to the staff. I think they will hasten to replace it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Mushroom toastie
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

4EoKcYssAIzXHguBWUTi-w.text: Kith is definitely my favorite brunch spot at Robertson Quay. It's cozy, the coffee's good and food is great - especially for the price.It's right down the street from where I live. So when I need some down-time to myself on the weekend, i'd head down here with a good book for a cup of latte and sandwiches. If the weather is nice you can people-watch by the river while enjoying your meal too! Love!On to the food - I usually get one of their sandwiches. It's easy no frills sandwich and cheap for what it is - they're priced at $8,$10 and $15. My favorite is the smoked salmon one for $10.I've had their big breakfast too and it's relatively cheap for about $15-16. It's a proper breakfast. Their mini toasties are good for if you don't feel like having any of the above but still want something to nibble on.Coffee is excellent.The only down side is, seating is mostly outdoors and there are no A/C, which can be downright unbearable when it's especially hot in Singapore

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked salmon sandwich $12 and a skinny latte $4

toH0CN7OZKd78Jw_qZQ_lw.text: Given that I had low expectations for this place, I was pretty impressed with the food and service. We were a group of four and though it was just, we were seated in a matter of a few minutes. I ordered a cheese pizza and pineapple ginger juice and my husband ordered some roast beef wrap thing. Both were pretty good (not to-die-for but not bad) and the juice was quite refreshing.

GkAwj66MtHYjp4yN4uw12g.text: Loved this place, I thought the coffee was strong and tasty, toasted sandwiches were nice and crisp and they had some great cookies, this place was a welcome break from the sun.

Ra7YIzuOD4wak2q4bXPjPw.text: Who love Mondays? Well I do 'cos I'm having lunch at kith's cafe. A little Monday pick-me-up lunch of Spaghetti Meatballs and Flat White makes my Monday that much sweeter. My first time here, I was abit disappointed that the place was a bit small (no seating inside) but managed to get a seat outside, facing the river. However, since it was a Monday, there wasn't much crowd save for the odd Caucasian couple with kids, Caucasian yuppies and a few passer-bys getting some takeaway coffee. The view was good - luckily the sky was overcast and the weather was cool; I can't imagine what it would be like if it is a hot sunny day!  Food was ok but coffee gets my nod of approval! I drank one cup and got another one to take back to the office. Will definitely drop by again - but not on weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cafe facade.
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Spaghetti meatballs

aQeXKgPPO_zciZ579K5hlg.text: This is always a stop for us along our walk. Great place to see friendly and smiling people. Breakfast is our favorite time here. However, lunch is delicious as well. Great coffee, and all at reasonable prices. Favorite stopping point for me on my frequent walks/jogs

ckKfAbUOT2ykodQ_xeKHxQ.text: The interior is very small- a couple of bar seats, and a long bench for a large group. Furnishing is pretty spartan, the legs of the bar and chairs reminds me of book stacks. Feels pretty much like an old classroom with the blackboard as well. The 'alfresco dining' is in fact a couple of tables and chairs/stools scattered along the corridor. Fits very much into the home and patio concept. I can see how the residents are drawn to this little spot.Breakfast food is a must have (if i have my way that is). I would also insist on all day breakfast too. We were there for tea so we didn't try the food.Kith's scone looks pretty but tastes crappy and it got worse as the temperature dropped. The texture is almost cardboard-ish and dry. It was only a little better with the.. wait for it... WHIPPED cream (oh how i hate it when they serve whipped instead of clotted). The jam was kinda weird with the watery texture. It looks like it was curdled and then defrosted. Anyway, just avoid the scone at all cost.Drinks are good though.

-a_wcHIieh7cscS97z5OQA.text: Friendly service, good food, reasonable prices (for Singapore) and litle unexpected added touches like apples with the toastie that turn this suburban corner cafe from ordinary to extraordinary¡!! Highly recommended but you'll need to beat off the joggers and mums with bubs to find a seat on a sunny day...

3h3qEKguUb7MYtQgOb5kag.text: A good advantage of staying relative near town is the accessibility to all these little cafes that are sprucing up in town. Kith Cafe has become one of my usual brunch places on the weekends to grab a quick bite with "free" parking. My typical brunch there would be their hotdog and a glass of  lychee watermelon iced blended. Kith Cafe is very popular with expat families and increasingly popular with the locals too.  Great place for informal group gathering and even playdates for the kids. It can be quite chaos  on weekends with kids and pets around.  Well, its one of the very few cafes that is both kids and pets friendly. Recently, my husband and I brought my 8 months old baby girl along to have brunch. She loves to sit and watch the older kids play. I think she must be wishing that she is old enough to join in the fun. Great place to people watch by the river too!

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Hotdog

wlX2KtKM2pSqOOPv_Qm3GQ.text: In all honesty, i can't see why theres so much hype about this place? probably cos of its indie concept and the fact that it appeared on Monocle.The tables and chairs were pathetic and tiny. The view... well by the canal (wouldn't really call it a river tho it connects to the Singapore River)Coffee was decent, but the toastie I had was terrible. I ordered a egg and ham toastie. it was very homemade style, which wasn't quite what i was looking for. Worst part of the toastie was that the scrambled eggs inside was definitely cooked eons ago and was too dry. more like a scrambled egg bits.Kitchen looked make-shift, small and dirty.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

xLZpz3ecA_BZz-0NJKsOgw.text: I thought the coffee here was excellent. I also had the toast with Jam for breakfast. The bread wasn't great, but the jam appeared to be homemade and was quite good although they don't really give you enough of it to cover the giant pieces of bread. On this weekend, the place looked like an expat daycare center because of all the toddlers running around--that could be a positive or negative depending on your point of view but just be aware. Plenty of seating outside though and a nice place to have a cup of joe.

qMyRQR-c79f1IR3SBX6eFw.text: Another addition to the brunch places popping up all over the city, Kith café is located along Robertson Quay and provides expats, families and yuppies with good coffee and sandwiches. On weekends, Kith is generally crowded unless you come a little later in the afternoon. I usually order an unsweetened iced coffee and a cheese and bacon toastie (I love the little apple slices they provide on the side to temper the savouriness of the toastie with crunchy sweetness). Sitting outside along the sidewalk with a newspaper and coffee at hand is a great way to spend a peaceful Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Front of the cafe

JT15owoK2lF8peLsyrxk7g.text: We walked with our dog close to three miles from Tangling Mall along Orchard road, through Ft. Canning park, down to Clarke Quay and finally Robertson Quay. Having the dog with us limited the places we could eat at but then we found Kith. They were happy to let us sit outside with him, even providing water for him. We ordered the smoked salmon sandwich and the steak sandwich. We also ordered the pineapple and ginger drinks. The service was prompt and friendly. The drinks were cold and refreshing, never having tasted pineapple and ginger before. The sandwiches were very tasty, the steak getting the slight edge over the smoked salmon. The side order of bacon for the dog was tasty enough that a couple of pieces did not make it to the intended customer. All in all it was a good experience, we will be back.
